intro: Hesperis grandiflora, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and elongated, branching stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its root system is fibrous and adapted to well-drained soils. Hesperis grandiflora is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
